editeur.controller

Interface IMediator

  • All Superinterfaces:
    SubjectObserve
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    Mediator

    public interface IMediator
extends SubjectObserve
    The interface IMediator. Handle the complicated communications beetween components as CareTaker, commands, observers, application and some shapes. Is also a singleton, so is accessible anywhere from the project. Simplify a lot the process, all high level operations are accessible from there, and everything is updated.

    • Method Detail

      • start

        void start()
        Define the start behavior. Auto load the old toolbar if exists else init it with 3 shapes.

      • group

        void group(IShape s)
        Group the selected shapes and add this group shape s. Everything is updated, handle the commands and update the view.
        Parameters:
        s - the shape

      • roundBorders

        void roundBorders(IShape r,
                  int roundWidth,
                  int roundHeight)
        Round borders of a rectangle else do nothing. Everything is updated.
        Parameters:
        r - the rectangle
        roundWidth - the round width wanted
        roundHeight - the round height wanted

      • unGroup

        void unGroup(IShape s,
             Composite group)
        Cancel the group composite, and add all its shapes to shape s ( his parent). Everything is updated.
        Parameters:
        s - the s
        group - the group

        Parameters:
        s - the shape
        r - the red value
        g - the green value
        b - the blue value

      • MouseClickEvent

        void MouseClickEvent(boolean fromToolbar,
                     int clickSide,
                     Point old,
                     Point to)
        Mouse click event: manage the current mouseEvent. Move the shape pointed by old point to to position. Else select the shapes contains in a rectangle from old to to position.
        Parameters:
        fromToolbar - the boolean from toolbar indicates if the point is from toolbar.
        clickSide - the click side
        old - the old position
        to - the to position

      • MouseDraggedEvent

        void MouseDraggedEvent(boolean fromToolbar,
                       int clickSide,
                       Point old,
                       Point to)
        Mouse click event for adding a tool ( a shape in the toolbar.) Simply clone and add the cloned shape at old position if exists and add it to the to position. Does nothing if from toolbar
        Parameters:
        fromToolbar - the boolean from toolbar indicates if the point is from toolbar.
        clickSide - the click side
        old - the old position
        to - the to position

      • MouseClickEventAddTool

        void MouseClickEventAddTool(boolean fromToolbar,
                            int clickSide,
                            Point old,
                            Point to)
        Mouse dragged event: Simply drag a shape from toolbar at old position and clone it to to position in whiteboard.
        Parameters:
        fromToolbar - the boolean from toolbar indicates if the point is from toolbar.
        clickSide - the click side
        old - the old position
        to - the to position

      • MouseTrashEvent

        void MouseTrashEvent(boolean fromToolbar,
                     int clickSide,
                     Point old,
                     Point to)

        Parameters:

        clickSide - the click side
        old - the old position
        to - the to position

      • ShowDraggedShape

        boolean ShowDraggedShape(boolean fromToolbar,
                         Point old,
                         Point to)
        Show dragged shape boolean : Draw the current dragged shape, disclaimer, a temporary clone is moved until we reach destination.
        Parameters:
        fromToolbar - the boolean from toolbar indicates if the point is from toolbar.
        old - the old position
        to - the to position
        Returns:
        the boolean : false if we dragged nothing.
